description.text: The advertisement on this poster is set within a blue frame. To the left it shows a tall adorned Indian elephant and its mahout carrying out two high-ranking persons in a seemingly gilded sedan chair with small canopy - one probably a British official wearing a pith helmet, the other an Indian noble-man with a turban. A large green tree-like object stretches to the right, while the elephant seems to walks on a river's shore. The rest of the poster, covering about 2/3 of the space is dedicated to the advertisement of Burmah Oil Company leaving only a small area for the tear-off calendar. Right above the calendar the Royal coat of arms of the United Kingdom is shown.

inscription.text: The Burmah Oil Company Limited (Scotland) Glasgow London Rangoon
Purveyors of Motor Spirit to H. M. The King Emperor Finest Mineral Wax & Stearine Candles

Manufacturers of burning, lubricating, batching, fuel and cylinder oils, grease, candles, paraffin wax, petrol etc. Burmah Lubricating Oils in many grades to suit all types of machinery Burmah Kerosene Oils Brands Waterlily - Oriental - Mosque - Firefly - Victoria - Lakshmi - Gold Mohur - Nemaz - Bottle - Sowar - Mahadeo - Chukker - Lion - King - Emperor.
Reffineries at Dunneedaw, Syriam, Bogyok & Yenangyat
Indian Agents Shaw Wallace & Co. Calcutta, Madras, Bombay, Karachi Bulloch Bros & Co. Ltd. Chittagong & Akyab
Managing Agents Finlay Fleming & Co. Rangoon.
dieu et mon droit [on the banner of the coat of arms]

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

description-en: The advertisement on this poster is set within a blue frame. To the left it shows a tall adorned Indian elephant and its mahout carrying out two high-ranking persons in a seemingly gilded sedan chair with small canopy - one probably a British official wearing a pith helmet, the other an Indian noble-man with a turban. A large green tree-like object stretches to the right, while the elephant seems to walks on a river's shore. The rest of the poster, covering about 2/3 of the space is dedicated to the advertisement of Burmah Oil Company leaving only a small area for the tear-off calendar. Right above the calendar the Royal coat of arms of the United Kingdom is shown. (ma)
